children.value: This should cover things like logging, tracing etc.
This article is a great reference.
We have a few methods we can use with
to help us be more proficient on how we log:
When going through a process across files and functions, attempt to use group to log the process.
Assertions may also become handy when
logic is involved for logging purposes.
Ensure these logs only show when running in a certain environment (ie not in production mode).
These are more guidelines that take influence from languages like Objective-C and personal decisions.
In the below gif, the "analytics" logs come from the Emitter module class.

If there is a possibility of an early return or error when logging and using groups, ensure that you adequately close the group off properly. If you cannot ensure that a group will close (ie entering a zone, mouse hover etc may not exit) then avoid the use of a group for that event and rely more on logs.
